body_html:
Hi @harshini-gadige thanks for looking into this. Seems like it's a problem with tensorflow-gpu in particular. I ran the script in 3 new cases:

  1. On Windows subsystem for Linux, it works with a fresh install of pip3 install tensorflow.
  2. On a new virtual environment in Windows, it works with pip install tensorflow.
  3. On a new virtual environment in Windows, it doesn't work with pip install tensorflow-gpu. Pip freeze of the broken one is:
absl-py==0.4.1
astor==0.7.1
gast==0.2.0
grpcio==1.15.0
Markdown==2.6.11
numpy==1.14.5
protobuf==3.6.1
six==1.11.0
tensorboard==1.10.0
tensorflow-gpu==1.10.0
termcolor==1.1.0
Werkzeug==0.14.1

Unfortunately the Linux subsystem doesn't support GPU, and I don't have a Linux install at the moment.

Edit: also tensorflow isn't available on python2.7 on windows.

body:
Hi @harshini-gadige thanks for looking into this. Seems like it's a problem with `tensorflow-gpu` in particular. I ran the script in 3 new cases:

1. On Windows subsystem for Linux, it works with a fresh install of `pip3 install tensorflow`.
2. On a new virtual environment in Windows, it works with `pip install tensorflow`.
3. On a new virtual environment in Windows, it *doesn't* work with `pip install tensorflow-gpu`. Pip freeze of the broken one is:
```
absl-py==0.4.1
astor==0.7.1
gast==0.2.0
grpcio==1.15.0
Markdown==2.6.11
numpy==1.14.5
protobuf==3.6.1
six==1.11.0
tensorboard==1.10.0
tensorflow-gpu==1.10.0
termcolor==1.1.0
Werkzeug==0.14.1
```

Unfortunately the Linux subsystem doesn't support GPU, and I don't have a Linux install at the moment.

Edit: also tensorflow isn't available on python2.7 on windows.
